org.wildfly.security.auth.provider

Class SimpleMapBackedSecurityRealm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wildfly.security.auth.provider.SimpleMapBackedSecurityRealm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SecurityRealm

    public class SimpleMapBackedSecurityRealm
extends Object
implements SecurityRealm
    Simple map-backed security realm. Uses an in-memory copy-on-write map methodology to map user names to passwords. Since this security realm implementation holds all names in memory, it may not be the best choice for very large security realms.
    Author:
    David M. Lloyd, Darran Lofthouse

    • Method Detail

      • setPasswordMap

        public void setPasswordMap(Map<NamePrincipal,Password> passwordMap)
        Set the password map. Note that the password map must not be modified after calling this method. If it needs to be changed, pass in a new map that is a copy of the old map with the required changes.
        Parameters:
        passwordMap - the password map

      • createRealmIdentity

        public RealmIdentity createRealmIdentity(String name)
        Description copied from interface: SecurityRealm
        For the given name create the RealmIdentity in the context of this security realm. Any validation / name mapping is an implementation detail for the realm. A realm returning a RealmIdentity does not confirm the existence of an identity, a realm may also return null from this method if the provided {code name} can not be mapped to an identity although this is not required of the realm.
        Specified by:
        createRealmIdentity in interface SecurityRealm
        Parameters:
        name - The name to use when creating the RealmIdentity
        Returns:
        The RealmIdentity for the provided name or null

      • createRealmIdentity

        public RealmIdentity createRealmIdentity(Principal principal)
        Description copied from interface: SecurityRealm
        Create a RealmIdentity from an existing Principal. TODO - Not entirely convinced we need this yet,
        Specified by:
        createRealmIdentity in interface SecurityRealm
        Parameters:
        principal - The principal to use to create the RealmIdentity
        Returns:
        The RealmIdentity for the provided principal or null

      • getCredentialSupport

        public CredentialSupport getCredentialSupport(Class<?> credentialType)
        Description copied from interface: SecurityRealm
        Determine whether a given credential is definitely supported, possibly supported (for some identities), or definitely not supported.
        Specified by:
        getCredentialSupport in interface SecurityRealm
        Parameters:
        credentialType - the credential type
        Returns:
        the level of support for this credential type
